Officials attending the hearings often argue that more money will solve management inefficiencies, but the government’s logic is that additional funds can actually amplify waste.  Historically, the state has provided money first and demanded efficiency later, resulting in a rising budget without clear improvements in education, health or security. The Tribunal replied that its employees work overtime and therefore require such support, a justification that places them above ordinary citizens who also work extra hours but lack comparable benefits.
